Posted By: UsagiYojimbo (8/17/2011 1:54:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The combo with this and [Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader) becomes a lot cooler with Phyrexian mana cards.  
Your turn: Drop an [Immolating Souleater](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Immolating Souleater) and pop this.  
Their turn: Give the Souleater to your opponent. Activate Souleater's ability until dead. (If their life total is odd you'll need to hit them for the last 1 point in some way, but you're playing red.)  
  
@infernox10: [Awakening Zone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Awakening Zone) and [Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader) will do it for you in Standard. Your turn, get a spawn token. Their turn, give them the spawn token and make them sac it. But [Prototype Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prototype Portal) is a much more reliable method of getting this effect repeatedly.
posts.html:
The combo with this and Bazaar Trader becomes a lot cooler with Phyrexian mana cards.
Your turn: Drop an Immolating Souleater and pop this.
Their turn: Give the Souleater to your opponent. Activate Souleater's ability until dead. (If their life total is odd you'll need to hit them for the last 1 point in some way, but you're playing red.)

@infernox10: Awakening Zone and Bazaar Trader will do it for you in Standard. Your turn, get a spawn token. Their turn, give them the spawn token and make them sac it. But Prototype Portal is a much more reliable method of getting this effect repeatedly.

posts.post_content: The first time I stuck this in a prototype portal in my mana ramp deck, the look on my usual playing companion's face was priceless. He was playing mono-black and was forced to watch his [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin)s kill every creature on his side of the field before turning on each other. The survivor of this was rewarded with a [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat) targeting him.

posts.post_content: First of all, I don't think this card really needs combos, but one I haven't heard much of is this and [Painful Quandary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painful Quandary). The life loss isn't paying life, so just play a few cards and your opponent loses, or at least get rid of their hand. Both of these are pretty decent on their own though, the weakness is high mana cost and vulnerability. This is one of the most fun cards in the game though, at least a 4.

posts.post_content:
My favorite moment of using this card, playing Commander:  
  
Mindslave my sister who has a Ghave, Guru of Spores deck. Have her attack with everything into my Kazuul, not paying the cost on any of the triggers, then have her sacrifice all of her dudes to Ghave, including sacrificing Ghave to himslf. On my next turn, use my 5/3 ogres (there was the War/Peace angel whose name escapes me on the board) to finish off both her and our friend we were playing with. I felt like the greatest evil mastermind ever.
posts.html:
My favorite moment of using this card, playing Commander:

Mindslave my sister who has a Ghave, Guru of Spores deck. Have her attack with everything into my Kazuul, not paying the cost on any of the triggers, then have her sacrifice all of her dudes to Ghave, including sacrificing Ghave to himslf. On my next turn, use my 5/3 ogres (there was the War/Peace angel whose name escapes me on the board) to finish off both her and our friend we were playing with. I felt like the greatest evil mastermind ever.
